title: the webdav feature does not support put with ranges (not implemented).
body:
put with ranges has been supported for ages by apache mod_dav, and it is compliant with rfc2616 (http 1.1) on which rfc 2518 (webdav) relies.

in fact, you don't rely on mod_dav, but rather on an implementation that presents itself as sabredav.

here is a log showing this feature lack:

    $ curl -x put http://localhost/owncloud/remote.php/webdav/foo.txt -d 'this is a test' -u myself:mypassword -v -h 'content-range: 22-'

    * about to connect() to localhost port 80 (#0)
    *   trying 127.0.0.1... connected
    * server auth using basic with user 'myself'
    > put /owncloud/remote.php/webdav/foo.txt http/1.1
    > authorization: basic txlzzwxmok15ugfzc3dvcmq=
    > user-agent: curl/7.22.0 (x86_64-pc-linux-gnu) libcurl/7.22.0 openssl/1.0.1 zlib/1.2.3.4 libidn/1.23 librtmp/2.3
    > host: localhost
    > accept: */*
    > content-range: 22-
    > content-length: 14
    > content-type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
    > 
    * upload completely sent off: 14out of 14 bytes
    < http/1.1 501 not implemented
    < date: sun, 30 dec 2012 23:33:12 gmt
    < server: apache/2.2.22 (ubuntu)
    < x-powered-by: php/5.3.10-1ubuntu3.4
    < set-cookie: 50e08d98c16de=7umcvu0s7utm17eaph4c2of227; path=/; httponly
    < expires: thu, 19 nov 1981 08:52:00 gmt
    < cache-control: no-store, no-cache, must-revalidate, post-check=0, pre-check=0
    < pragma: no-cache
    < set-cookie: 50e08d98c16de=9ftp82svq5nhkqs7bv4qai21f4; path=/; httponly
    < content-length: 285
    < connection: close
    < content-type: application/xml; charset=utf-8
    < 
    <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
    <d:error xmlns:d="dav:" xmlns:s="http://sabredav.org/ns">
      <s:exception>sabre_dav_exception_notimplemented</s:exception>
      <s:message>put with content-range is not allowed.</s:message>
      <s:sabredav-version>1.6.4</s:sabredav-version>
    </d:error>
    * closing connection #0


it does clearly state the this feature is not implemented and return http error 501... which, i must admit, is still compliant with rfc2616 as it says under the put paragraph an implementation should return 501 when the content-* headers are ignored.

this is still a lack of feature, considering mod_dav has it!

[edit] ... but maybe the implementation of the feature should be pushed 'upstream' to the sabredav guy? i just checked they have a google code account

[edit2] as the log above says, you use version 1.6.4 of sabredav, and they are now at version 1.8
so, before reporting to them, i'll try their version 1.8 to see if the feature has been implemented.
